task.title: Naming files and folders
task.shortdesc: Give special attention to the names of files and folders. These will be used in your maps, and with allow your maps to be read like tables of contents, making your work much easier.

section.title: Use lower case rather than upper case and use the underscore character rather than a space
section.p: Use lower case except when it would be perverse not to do so, e.g. in organization names.
For example, the name of the source file for this DITA topic is naming_files_and_folders.xml.

section.title: Put legacy structurall features at the end of titles, in brackets
section.p: In migration projectjs, it's quite possible that you will want to keep a record of original titles. This might help to to complte a migration, or it might help existing readers who are used to referring to a document called "PROC 1234", or an appendix called "Appendix A".
Try to be helpful to your readers.
For example, as a topic title or the title of a map.
section.lq: How to apply for a deviation (Appendix A)
section.p:
This has the triple purpose of:
deprecating these structural elements, when all you really want to worry about is topic title and maps
maintain a record of where the topic or section element came from, visible even in the map (for topcv titles)
allowing you to quietly drop the strucral element in the future withour significantly altering the title
